etymology.description: semantic: 扌(手) (shǒu, "hand") + phonetic: 卡(卡) (qiǎ, "block") = hand stops -> derived sense of card, calorie
etymology.interpretation: The character 卡(卡) (kǎ, "card") combines 扌(手) (shǒu, "hand") representing a holding or grasping action and 卡(卡) (qiǎ, "block") to convey the idea of stopping or blocking. This hints at the function of a card as a tangible object one handles or processes for a specific purpose.

examples.chinese: 我用信用卡购物(我用信用卡購物)。
examples.english: I shop using a credit card.

examples.chinese: 请刷卡(請刷卡)，进入大楼(進入大樓)。
examples.english: Please swipe your card, and then enter the building.

examples.chinese: 这个运动消耗了很多卡路里(這個運動消耗了很多卡路里)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège yùndòng xiāohào le hěn duō kǎlùlǐ.
